info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 05 at 6:52PM EDT until April 05 at 7:15PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM EDT FOR PORTIONS OF COLLETON AND DORCHESTER COUNTIES... At 651 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located near Canadys, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. Locations impacted include: Saint George, Harleyville, Reevesville, Smoaks, Williams, Ruffin and Canadys. This warning includes the following interstates: I-26 between mile markers 172 and 174. I-95 in South Carolina between mile markers 61 and 82. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: Report damage directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 888-383-2024 when it is safe to do so.
